page.title: 07TREE SURVEY _ OGBOURNE AREA
page.content: The aim of this survey was to study the distribution, type and purpose of{ {trees}on a route from Rockley via Ogbourne Maizey to Ogbourne St Andrew. In the{villages,}the trees are mostly decorative and fruit trees. On the{farms,}they have been planted as windbreaks, and there are screens of ash, silver birch, beech, sycamore, oak, maple, holly, elm, hawthorn, hazel and conifers. Along the{roadsides}are poplar saplings, old hedges and occasional ash trees. Along the{riverside}are old and sapling willows. There are very few trees on the {downland,}just occasional shelter belts of beech and/or conifers.
